meanings.definition: A type of rawhide or sinew cord used by Native Americans for making snowshoes, nets, and other items.
meanings.sent1: The babiche was strong and flexible, perfect for crafting snowshoes.
meanings.sent2: She carefully weaved the babiche into a sturdy net for fishing.
meanings.sent3: The playful squirrel got tangled in the babiche and had a funny dance trying to free itself.
meanings.sent4: His words were like babiche, binding us together in a web of trust.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns of the babiche were a work of art in themselves.

meanings.definition: To make or repair items using babiche.
meanings.sent1: He babiched together a new snowshoe for his winter adventures.
meanings.sent2: They babiche their fishing nets skillfully to ensure a good catch.
meanings.sent3: She babiched so fast that her friends joked she had magical crafting powers.
meanings.sent4: The community babiched their resources to rebuild the playground after the storm.
meanings.sent5: With determination, they babiched a solution to fix the broken canoe.
